system.description:
• Claudia can pass beyond the construct for a short time just as she could with the tower, but within a minute of leaving the construct the binding stone cementing her to this plane of existence summons her back.

    • If the stone is destroyed she will be instantly thrown into the astral plane from whence she came and Nep Nik will walk the world without her influence.

    • At any moment Nep NIk could destroy the binding stone that binds Claudia to this plane of existence.

      • She is well aware of this, and leaves her fate in his hands to prove her faith and trust in him.

• Claudia can use gold from Nep Nik’s reserves/from the battlefield to mend him as a bonus action.

    • Note: If he wants to remain as unarmored, she can use the gold to heal him and keep him there as long as a bonus action is available.

      • However, if he is reduced to 0HP, he will fall into disrepair and the Binding Stone pulls Claudia inside to protect her.

        • Someone else will have to use gold and fire to repair him.

    • Alternatively, she can use this to pull gold from him to change up his build, lowering his HP to drop him from Heavy to Medium or Medium to Unarmored.

• Those who are near a Kazrem Azryel often describe the feeling of being seen entirely, inside and out.

    • Their natural perceptiveness gives them a keen advantage over their surroundings and a deeper insight into those they can see.

  • Although Claudia has given up much of her Kazrem Azryel power, she remains adept at picking out lies.

    • Whenever you make an Intelligence (Insight) check to determine whether a creature is lying or hiding something, treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as an automatic roll of 10.

  • Claudia is proficient in the Perception and Insight skills, but uses Nep Nik’s Intelligence modifier in place of Wisdom.

• Walls do not obstruct her ability to feel what is beyond them and, if she wishes, Claudia can step out of the construct and through a wall to get a better look at what she believes may be on the other side.

    • She may choose to remain invisible to the naked eye or show herself in her Banshee form.

      • During this she cannot use other abilities or aid Nep Nik.

    • This can only happen once per long rest.

• Claudia has the Aid Cantrip and can use it once per short/long rest.

      • Casting Time: Free action

      • A tendril of her energy snaps out from Nep Nik at an hour of need and aids a teammate within 30 feet by adding 1d4 to their saving throw.

    • She may choose a Cantrip at this time from the Cleric Spell List.

    • The Banshee table shows how many spells and spell slots she has from the Cleric Spell list.

      • Spells and Cantrips are found Here: Cleric Spell List - DND 5th Edition

      • Claudia immediately knows three 1st-level cleric spells of your choice, two of which must be chosen from the divination and necromancy spells on the cleric spell list.

        • Each spell learned from here on through 7th-level must come from the Divination and Necromancy spells

          • You can replace these spells whenever you gain a level, but the assortment of spells must stay the same.

          • The spells you learn at 8th, 14th, and 20th levels can come from any Cleric’s school of magic.

        • To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher.

        • You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

      • SPELLCASTING ABILITY

        • Nep Nik’s Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your cleric spells.

        • You use Nep Nik’s Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability.

          • In addition, you use Nep Nik’s Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a cleric spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

        • Spell save DC = 8+ your proficiency bonus + Nep Nik’s Intelligence modifier

        • Spell attack modifier your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

• Starting at 2nd Level, Claudia may use a bonus action to reach out a spiritual tendril and touch a creature adjacent to the construct, casting Living Nightmares on that creature.

      • They see the thing they are most terrified of appearing before them and must react unless they roll an Intelligence Contest to save.

        • The DM chooses how they react.

        • If successful, she cannot use this ability again on the same creature.

      • You can only use this ability an equal amount to your Intelligence proficiency bonus between each short or long rest.

activation.reactionTrigger: When Nep Nik (or a companion) grapples a creature within 5 feet.

system.description:
• When Nep Nik (or a companion) grapples a creature within 5 feet, Claudia may envelop them for a moment, surrounding them in nightmares, Blinding, Deafening, or Restraining them for a turn (your choice).

    • She may remain behind and stay attached to the creature as long as she isn’t shaken loose.

      • The creature must roll an intelligence contest save to free themselves.

      • Claudia cannot use any of her abilities until she lets go or is shaken free.

    • The terror cripples them, making them unable to make a noise until the Grappled Terror ends.

      • They take 1d4 psychic damage per turn

• Claudia can use Nep Nik’s bonus action to open spiritual eyes that glow and hover in the air around the Construct.

    • The eyes have an ethereal quality and can be sustained without concentration for 1 minute.

      • For the duration, creatures within 30 feet of you can’t gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being invisible or unseen.

      • Creatures that are invisible or unseen are revealed to Nep Nik

    • You can only use this ability an equal amount to your Intelligence proficiency bonus between each short or long rest.

fLAwCIOUGkt6r38b.onSave: They take half damage and are only pulled 10 feet

system.description:
(cleric, druid, ranger, sorcerer, warlock, wizard)

  • You fire a projectile of condensed gravitational force toward a creature you can see within range.
    • Make a ranged spell attack against the target.
    • On a hit, the target takes 2d8 force damage and is pulled 20 feet in a
      straight line toward you.
      • If they're successful with their dexterity save they take half the damage and are only pulled 10 feet

Cast at Higher Levels:

  • When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

 

Source: Steinhardt's Guild Spells

(Cleric)

You impart fell energies that suck away the target's life force, making a melee spell attack that deals 3d10 necrotic damage.

Cast at Higher Levels. The damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

(Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard)

Until the spell ends, you automatically sense the presence of magic within range, and you can use an action to study the aura of a magic effect to learn its schools of magic (if any).

The spell penetrates most barriers but is blocked by 3 feet of wood or dirt, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or a thin sheet of lead.

Cast at Higher Levels:

  • When using a 2nd-level spell slot or higher, the spell no longer requires your concentration.
  • When using a 3rd-level spell slot, the duration increases to 1 hour.
  • When using a 4th-level spell slot or higher, the duration increases to 8 hours.

introduce-me.flavor: Banshee of Elden Keep - Last of the Kazrem Azryel
